dublinCore.title: 113 HR 2557 IH: Imprisonment for Tax Targeting of Americans Act of 2013
dublinCore.rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Sam Johnson of Texas introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to make imprisonment mandatory for unauthorized disclosure of returns and return information, unauthorized inspection of returns or return information, and willful oppression under color of law by officers and employees of the United States, and for other purposes.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Imprisonment for Tax Targeting of Americans Act of 2013 .

section.header: Mandatory fines, imprisonment, and costs of prosecution for unauthorized disclosure of returns and return information

subsection.text: The second sentence of section 7213(a)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking a fine and all that follows through or both and inserting a fine in accordance with title 18, United States Code, and imprisonment of 5 years.

The second sentence of section 7213(a)(2) of such Code is amended by striking a fine and all that follows through or both and inserting a fine in accordance with title 18, United States Code, and imprisonment of 5 years.

The second sentence of section 7213(a)(3) of such Code is amended by striking a fine and all that follows through or both and inserting a fine in accordance with title 18, United States Code, and imprisonment of 5 years.

The second sentence of section 7213(a)(4) of such Code is amended by striking a fine and all that follows through or both and inserting a fine in accordance with title 18, United States Code, and imprisonment of 5 years.
The amendments made by this section shall apply to violations occurring after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Mandatory fines, imprisonment, and costs of prosecution for unauthorized inspection of returns or return information

subsection.text: Paragraph (1) of section 7213A(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking a fine and all that follows through or both and inserting a fine in accordance with title 18, United States Code, and imprisonment of 5 years.
The amendment made by subsection (a) shall apply to violations occurring after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Mandatory fine and imprisonment for willful oppression under color of law by officers and employees of the United States

subsection.text:
The first sentence of
section 7214(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking or both and inserting , or both, and in the case of willful oppression under color of law, shall be fined in accordance with title 18, United States Code, and imprisoned not more than 5 years.
The amendment made by subsection (a) shall apply to offenses occurring after the date of the enactment of this Act.
